snippet: Despite a history of strained relations, the United States and Russia have been working effectively to investigate the marathon bombings, American officials said.
abstract: Obama administration officials say American authorities investigating Boston Marathon bombings are working effectively with their Russian counterparts, despite years of differences on how to approach terrorist threats; say they hope experience will usher in a new era of cooperation on counterterrorism.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: Despite a history of strained relations, the United States and Russia have been working effectively to investigate the marathon bombings, American officials said.

headline.seo: U.S. Says Russia Is Aiding Inquiry into Boston Attacks
headline.main: U.S. Hopes Russian Aid in Inquiry on Boston Bombings Signals Future Collaboration
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hopes Russian Aid in Inquiry on Boston Bombings Signals Future Collaboration
